RepoBird CLI allows you to run AI-powered tasks on your repositories,
manage runs, and integrate with the RepoBird platform.

Usage:
  repobird [command]

Available Commands:
  auth        Manage authentication and API keys
  bulk        Submit multiple runs in parallel from configuration files
  completion  Generate shell completion scripts
  config      Manage RepoBird configuration
  docs        Generate documentation
  help        Help about any command
  run         Create a new run from a JSON, YAML, or Markdown file
  status      Check the status of runs
  tui         Launch the interactive Terminal User Interface
  version     Print version information

Flags:
      --config string   config file (default is $HOME/.repobird/config.yaml)
      --debug           enable debug output
      --debug-user      enable debug user mode with mock data
  -h, --help            help for repobird

Use "repobird [command] --help" for more information about a command.
